byline.original: By HARI KUMAR and ELLEN BARRY

abstract: Two witnesses report to India’s National Human Rights Commission that 20 day laborers for illegal red sandalwood logging operation were detained by anti-smuggling task force and shot while in custody; officers had claimed killings were in self defense.
lead_paragraph: Day laborers became casualties in a decades-old war over the red sandalwood, an endangered tree often targeted by smugglers.

headline.main: Witnesses to Indian Loggers’ Killing Dispute Police Claims of Self-Defense
headline.print_headline: Witnesses to Indian Loggers’ Killing Dispute Police Claims of Self-Defense

snippet: Day laborers became casualties in a decades-old war over the red sandalwood, an endangered tree often targeted by smugglers.
